s.text: The problem is that they don't know enough people in those racial groups, so their brains will use race as the most distinctive characteristic about that person.
The problem is that they don't know enough people in those racial groups, so their brains will use race as the most distinctive characteristic about that person.
Drawing upon her rich experience of life, Prudence (Prudie to her friends) responds to questions about manners, personal relations, politics, and other subjects.
They know so many white people that they classify them by other traits--such as shape of the face, hair color, body shape.
